cards.desc:
You will be making a personal portfolio website where you can showcase your projects in the future!

It needs to have 3 sections - About me, Portfolio and Contact me.

Only HTML and CSS allowed!

[Suggested designs](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/html/designs "‌")
[Design](http://www.webdesign-inspiration.com "‌")
[ideas](http://www.awwwards.com/websites/portfolio "‌")
[here](http://www.hongkiat.com/blog/creative-portolio-designs "‌")

[Free](https://pixabay.com/en/photos "‌")
[Stock](http://www.freeimages.com "‌")
[Images](https://www.pexels.com "‌")
[Here](https://unsplash.com "‌")

[Free HD](https://mixkit.co "‌")
[Videos](https://videos.pexels.com "‌")

[Portfolio webpage template](https://themes.3rdwavemedia.com/demo/orbit "‌")

An example of the kind of thing to aim for: [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/portfolio-example/](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/portfolio-example/ "‌")

Deploy to [Github Pages](https://guides.github.com/features/pages "‌")

[Sprint Review & Retro info](%22%E2%80%8C%22 "‌")

[HTML/CSS Style Guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/htmlcssguide.html "‌")

‌
cards.name: 💁 Project 1: Portfolio (HTML & CSS)

cards.desc: Design and build a website with at least an About me, Portfolio and Contact sections.
cards.name: Story 1: Portfolio

cards.desc:
In this individual project, you will be making a website that displays a collection of items. You can choose any theme for your collection!

You will be creating an SQL database of items and a PHP website with HTML & CSS to showcase them.
cards.name: 🚗🚕🚙 Project 2: Collection App (PHP)

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **collector**
_I want:_ **to be able to see stored information about my collection**
_So that:_ **I can show off to my friends**

Requirements:

- Items must be tied to a theme
- Each item should have at least 3 stats about it
- Database structure signed off by trainer before continuing
- Information from database must be visually displayed with the stats of each item

‌
cards.name: Story 1: Display collection

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **collector**
_I want:_ **to be able to add new items to my collection**
_So that:_ **I can expand my collection**

Requirements:

- Must be able to add a new item to the collection
- Item must be available forever

‌
cards.name: Story 2: Add item

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **collector**
_I want:_ **to be able to delete an item from my collection**
_So that:_ **I can accurately show which items I have**

Requirements:

- Must have ability to delete item from the collection
- Deletion should permanently remove the item from the webpage

‌
cards.name: Story 3: Delete item

cards.desc:
This is a JavaScript game where the user types as fast as possible!

The game starts by giving you text to type, as well as a textbox to type into. As soon as you start typing, the game starts and you have 60 seconds to type. The objective is to type as many correct words as possible from the text in one minute.

The game relies on space characters to tell when you’ve finished typing a word. You can correct any mistakes with backspace or delete, but after you press space, the word is already counted as correct or incorrect.

When the time is up, you get your score in WPM (words per minute), as well as your accuracy in % (how many correct words typed out of all words typed). A “restart“ button appears in case you want to play again.
cards.name: 🔡⏱ Project 3: Typing speed test (JS)

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **player**
_I want:_ **to see with each letter I type whether I am correct so far**
_So that:_ **I can correct words before it is too late**

Requirements:

- When the user starts typing a word, the word immediately becomes coloured in the source text
- If everything correct so far - green
- If the user has typed a wrong letter - red
- If the user corrects their mistakes, the word returns to green
- When the user types a space, the word is finished, so it remains either green or red in the source text and they cannot correct it anymore

‌
cards.name: Story 5: Checking correctness on every key press

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **player**
_I want:_ **a button that restarts the game**
_So that:_ **I can try again**

Requirements:

- The button should appear only when the game is finished
- When clicking the button, the game should restart without refreshing the page

‌
cards.name: Story 6: Restart

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **player**
_I want:_ **the game to save my personal high score**
_So that:_ **I can compare my scores to my best score so far**

Requirements:

- When the game is finished, alongside all the stats about the just-finished game, it should display the WPM high score (all time highest result for this user)
- If the player has just beat the high score, it should say “New high score!“
- The personal high score is stored locally on each device, not shared between all users of the site

‌
cards.name: Story 7: Personal high score

cards.desc:
Let’s face it: cooking at home is just way too much effort. Consumers are begging for a way to order food online and have it delivered to their door. Hence, iO Corp have decided to make their own food delivery app!

Another team has already created an API backend for this app, so you will be working on the React front-end. This is a common way of architecting an app - the backend and frontend are separate applications that interact using HTTP requests.
cards.name: 🍔 Project 4: Food Delivery App (React)

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **diner**
_I want:_ **to see which restaurants I can order from**
_So That:_ **I can decide where to eat**

Requirements:

- Use the supplied designs:
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/homepage_desktop.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/homepage_desktop.png "‌")
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/homepage_mobile.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/homepage_mobile.png "‌")
- Use the supplied API:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/food-delivery-api](https://github.com/iO-Academy/food-delivery-api "‌")

‌
cards.name: Story 1: Display available restaurants

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **diner**
_I want:_ **to see the menu for my chosen restaurant**
_So That:_ **I can think about what I want to eat**

Requirements:

- Use the supplied designs:
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png "‌")
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png "‌")
- Use the supplied API:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/food-delivery-api](https://github.com/iO-Academy/food-delivery-api "‌")
- Must be able to return to list of available restaurants

‌
cards.name: Story 2: See restaurant menu

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **diner**
_I want:_ **to be able to add food to my order**
_So That:_ **I can decide what I want to eat**

Requirements:

- Use supplied designs:
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png "‌")
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png "‌")
- Must be able to add any food item to the order
- Must be able to add multiple food items to the order
- Must be able to reduce the amount of each item
- Reducing an item to 0 should remove it from the order

‌
cards.name: Add food to an order

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **diner**
_I want:_ **to see how much my order is going to cost**
_So that:_ **I can decide if I can afford it**

Requirements:

- Use supplied designs:
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png "‌")
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png "‌")
- Must calculate an order total for each item added
- Must update as items are added/removed
- Must add £0.99 delivery fee
- Must add £1.50 service fee
- Must display an order total

‌
cards.name: Calculate order price

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **diner**
_I want:_ **to be able to order my food**
_So that:_ **I can eat it**

Requirements:

- Must display a "Place order" button
- Placing an order must send the data to the API
- Must display a modal to the user with their order details as per the designs:
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/order_desktop.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/order_desktop.png "‌")
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/order_mobile.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/order_mobile.png "‌")

‌
cards.name: Place an order

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **diner**
_I want:_ **to be able to filter the menu by food type**
_So that:_ **I can find what I want quicker**

Requirements:

- Use supplied designs
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_desktop.png "‌")
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/foodDelivery/menu_mobile.png "‌")
- Must dynamically create the filter options based on available food for each restaurant
- Must only be able to select 1 filter at a time
- All food items with no type or side must be grouped into an "Other" filter
- Must have a way of removing the filter

‌
cards.name: Filter foods

cards.desc:
Many companies use online tools to organise their projects. iO Corp have decided that none of the tools available on the market are good enough for the job, so they have asked the devs to create an in-house tool.

The front-end has already been created by another team. Now it is your team’s job to write the backend. You will be using PHP OOP and SQL to create a backend API.
cards.name: 🧑‍💼Project 5: Project Management API (PHP OOP)

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **developer**
_I want:_ **to have a plan for all the classes and how they will interact**
_So that:_ **I have a guide for development**

Requirements:

- Must create a plan for the app architecture including:
  - All the classes that will exist
  - All the methods required to complete the functionality of the app
  - Preferably also the inputs and output of all the methods
  - How the classes will interact with each other
- The architecture can be written in any format
  - Diagram
  - Text
  - Any format as long as everyone in the team can understand it
- Needs to be signed off by senior dev

‌
cards.name: Story 1: App architecture

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **project manager**
_I want:_ **to be able to see all active projects**
_So That:_ **I know what the company is working on**

Requirements:

- Must follow supplied API documentation:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template "smartCard-inline")
- Must work with supplied front-end:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe "‌")
- Must use supplied DB:
  [https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/project\_manager/project\_manager.sql](https://dev.io-academy.uk/resources/project_manager/project_manager.sql "‌")

‌
cards.name: Story 2: Get all projects

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **project manager**
_I want:_ **to be able to retrieve all information about a specific project**
_So that:_ **I can see what the project is and who is assigned to it**

Requirements:

- Must use supplied API documentation:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-a-specific-project](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-a-specific-project "smartCard-inline")
- Must work with supplied FE:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe "smartCard-inline")
- Must supply dates in UK date format (dd/mm/yyyy)

‌
cards.name: Story 3: Get specific project

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **project manager**
_I want:_ **to be able to see which tasks are assigned to a specific user for a chosen project**
_So that:_ **I know what people are working on**

Requirements:

- Must use supplied API documentation:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-all-tasks-assigned-to-a-specific-user-for-a-specified-project](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-all-tasks-assigned-to-a-specific-user-for-a-specified-project "smartCard-inline")
- Must work with supplied FE:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe "smartCard-inline")
- Must supply dates in UK format (dd/mm/yyyy)
- Must calculate if a task is overdue or not

‌
cards.name: Story 4: Get tasks assigned to user for specific project

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **project assignee**
_I want:_ **to see the details of a task**
_So that:_ **I know what work is required**

Requirements:

- Must use supplied API documentation:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-a-specific-task](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-a-specific-task "smartCard-inline")
- Must work with supplied FE:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe "smartCard-inline")
- Must supply dates in UK format (dd/mm/yyyy)
- Must calculate if the task is currently overdue or not

‌
cards.name: Story 5: Get specific task

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **member of staff**
_I want:_ **to be able to set my location to US**
_So that:_ **the supplied information is in US format**

Requirements:

- Must use the supplied API documentation:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#api-documentation](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#api-documentation "smartCard-inline")
- Must work with supplied FE:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe "smartCard-inline")
- All routes with a `locale` parameter must default to UK if not provided
- if US provided, dates must be provided in US format (mm-dd-yyyy)
- if US provided, task estimates must be provided in hours and days instead of points
  - Use the below conversions:
    - 1 point = 4 hrs = 0.5days
    - 2 points = 8 hrs = 1 day
    - 3 points = 12 hrs = 1.5days
    - 5 points = 24 hrs = 3 days
    - 8 points = 40 hrs = 5 days
    - 13 points = 80 hrs = 10 days

‌
cards.name: Story 6: Set US or UK location

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **project manager**
_I want:_ **to be able to find projects for a specific client**
_So that:_ **I can find the project im looking for faster**

Requirements:

- use supplied API documentation:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-all-projects-optionally-filtered-by-client](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-management-api-template#return-all-projects-optionally-filtered-by-client "smartCard-inline")
- Must work with supplied FE:
  [https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe](https://github.com/iO-Academy/project-manager-fe "smartCard-inline")

‌
cards.name: Story 7: Filter projects by client

cards.desc:
The Academy Portal is a student-made internal tool for managing applicants and students of iO Academy. It is not yet used by iO but we hope soon it will be ready!

The Product Owner of the Portal is Mike and he looks after the story backlog.

Repository: [https://github.com/iO-Academy/AcademyPortal](https://github.com/iO-Academy/AcademyPortal "smartCard-inline")

A test deployment with dummy data can be found here:
[https://portal.dev.io-academy.uk/](https://portal.dev.io-academy.uk/ "smartCard-inline")
email: [test@test.com](mailto:test@test.com "‌")
password: nickloveslemons
cards.name: 🪄🔮 Project 6: Academy Portal

cards.desc:
The Final project is your chance to flex all your new skills!

- Choice of pre-made project specs (TBC)
- Working in groups of 3 or 4 (depending how the class splits)
- Whatever tech stack you want
- No mandatory code reviews
- No mandatory git branching rules
- No mandatory scrum process
- Or you can choose to have all of the usual process in place
- Only remaining rule is Friday sprint review (the final one!)

Exciting!

‌
cards.name: 🧑‍🎓💎 Project 7: Final project
s4-t2 html and css for results screen
s4-t3 javascript to start and update timer
s4-t5 js to stop game and display results screen

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **player**
_I want:_ **a timer counting down and results at the end**
_So that:_ **I can try my best to type within the time limit**

Requirements:

- Timer starts at 60 seconds
- It only starts counting down once the user has started typing
- When the timer ends, stop the game from accepting input and display the results of the game as per the wireframe

‌
cards.name: Story 4: Timed game

cards.desc:
The current word being typed is shown on the screen and simultaneously stored in a variable (console.log the variable on each keypress).

Filter user input as follows:

- search and replace `\u00e9` and all other accented characters with non-accented characters
- convert to lower case
- delete all non abc0123' characters

Delete the user input on space
cards.name: S3T1: User input

cards.desc:
‌

- filter and transform each word in the fetched text array in the same way as for user input
- store in a variable as the comparison words array
cards.name: S3T2: convert text into comparison words array

cards.desc:
- make variable currentComparisonWord
- compare current user input with currentComparisonWord
- console.log results
- update  currentComparisonWord on space
- [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/shift](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/shift "smartCard-inline")
cards.name: S3T3: console.log 'correct' or 'incorrect' on space, depending on word match

cards.desc: This requires also iterating through the span element array on space, as well as the comparison words.
cards.name: S3T4: add 'correct' or 'incorrect' css class to the span element corresponding to the last word

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **player**
_I want:_ **to be able to type words into the game and see if they are correct**
_So that:_ **I can play the game and see how I’m doing**

Requirements:

- The user types a word and then presses space, which locks in the word
- If the word was wrong, it becomes red in the source text
- If correct, it becomes green in the source text
- As the user types a space, the textbox they are typing in becomes blank, ready for them to type the next word

‌
cards.name: Story 3: Typing words
s4-t1 html and css for timer itself

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **Product Owner**
_I want:_ **wireframes for the typing speed test game**
_So that:_ **I can sign off on the design before development starts**

Requirements:

A wireframe for the main page of the game including:

- A heading with the name of the game
- An area that shows the text the user needs to type
- A box where the user is currently typing
- A timer counting down from 60 seconds
- When the time is up - show the following:
  - Words per minute = e.g. “53 words per minute”
  - Accuracy - e.g. “88.3% (53/60 words correct)“
  - If story 5 is accepted - restart button
  - If story 6 is accepted - personal high score of words per minute

‌
cards.name: Story 1: Game design

cards.desc:
_As a:_ **player**
_I want:_ **to see the static game screen**
_So that:_ **I can get ready to play**

Requirements:

- Webpage displaying all elements on the page up to and including story 3
- Text should be generated by sending a GET request to [this URL](https://flipsum-ipsum.net/api/icw/v1/generate?ipsum=recipe-ipsum-text-generator&start_with_fixed=0&paragraphs=4 "‌")
- No functionality to play the game as of yet

‌
cards.name: Story 2: Static game screen

cards.desc: Split the returned string by spaces. Store the split string array in a variable. Map the split string array into span elements. Store span elements array in a variable. Insert span elements into a div.
cards.name: S2T2: Fetch request
*Test coverage sufficient and tests passed (automated tests)* = 0 in this case
Accessibility tested (0 errors on WAVE at least)
